insightCards.title: Masala tea

insightCards.title: Middle Eastern Tea
insightCards.desc: A fragrant tea brewed with black tea leaves, often infused with cardamom, mint, or saffron, and served sweetened in small glasses. Warm and inviting!

insightCards.title: Hot chocolate
insightCards.desc: Rich, creamy drink made with melted chocolate , steamed milk, and a touch of sweetness. marshmallows!

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (about 205°F)

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the V60?
howWorks.p1: The V60 is specifically designed to give you full control over the coffee brewing process. This tool features a 60-degree cone with spiral ridges inside that guide the water flow and prevent clogging. Its thin, specially-made paper filter plays a crucial role in removing unwanted oils and coffee particles. By pouring water in a steady, circular motion over the ground coffee, the water gently passes through the coffee bed, extracting a balanced and clean brew. The V60 is truly a combination of science and art, offering a precise and delightful brewing experience.
howWorks.p2: The V60 is not only a simple tool for brewing coffee but also one of the most flexible and efficient methods for achieving a high-quality cup. Its unique design allows you to control every aspect, from brewing time to water temperature and grind size. This precise control results in a clean and transparent extraction that highlights the subtle flavors of the coffee. Additionally, the V60 is lightweight, portable, and highly affordable, making it a popular choice among coffee enthusiasts, whether at home or on the go.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Chemex
brewingMethods.description: Elegant brewing for a clean and flavorful cup

steps.title: Prepare the Filter
steps.description: Place the Chemex filter into the brewer, ensuring the triple-layered side is against the spout. Rinse thoroughly with hot water to eliminate the paper taste and preheat the Chemex. Discard the rinse water.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 42g of coffee beans and grind them to a medium-coarse consistency, similar to sea salt.

steps.title: Add Coffee to Chemex
steps.description: Place the ground coffee into the filter and give it a gentle shake to level the bed.

steps.title: Start the Bloom
steps.description: Begin pouring hot water (93°C to 96°C) in a slow, circular motion until the coffee grounds are fully saturated (approximately 80-100ml). Let it bloom for 30-45 seconds.

steps.title: Continue Pouring
steps.description: Gradually pour the remaining water in circles, avoiding the sides of the filter, until you've added a total of 700ml. Pause occasionally to prevent overfilling.

steps.title: Allow Coffee to Drip
steps.description: Let the brewed coffee completely pass through the filter, which should take about 4-5 minutes.

steps.title: Remove the Filter
steps.description: Carefully remove the filter with the spent coffee grounds and discard it.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Gently swirl the Chemex to mix the coffee before pouring. Serve immediately and savor the clean, nuanced flavors.

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (93°C to 96°C)

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Chemex?
howWorks.p1: The Chemex is a beautifully designed pour-over coffee maker that uses a thick paper filter to remove unwanted oils and fine particles, delivering a clean and crisp cup. Its hourglass shape aids in maintaining an even extraction by channeling the water through the coffee bed uniformly. The Chemex's simplicity and precision make it an ideal tool for crafting an elegant, flavorful coffee experience.
howWorks.p2: The Chemex stands out for its blend of style and functionality. Its thick filters produce exceptionally clean brews, highlighting delicate flavors and reducing bitterness. This brewer is perfect for making multiple servings and is as much a decorative piece as it is a functional one. Whether you're hosting guests or enjoying a quiet morning, the Chemex delivers consistent and stunning results every time.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with AeroPress
brewingMethods.description: Quick and versatile brewing for rich coffee

steps.title: Prepare the Filter
steps.description: Place a paper filter into the AeroPress filter cap and rinse it with hot water to eliminate any paper taste and preheat the brewing vessel.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 14-18g of coffee beans, then grind them to a medium-fine consistency, similar to table salt.

steps.title: Assemble AeroPress
steps.description: Set up the AeroPress on a stable, flat surface with the filter cap securely attached to the chamber. If you’re using the inverted method, make sure the plunger is at the bottom, and the filter cap is removed.

steps.title: Add Coffee Grounds
steps.description: Place the ground coffee into the AeroPress, making sure it’s evenly distributed in the chamber.

steps.title: Pour Hot Water
steps.description: Pour 200-250ml of hot water (around 93°C) over the grounds in a circular motion, ensuring the coffee is fully saturated. Stir gently to ensure even extraction.

steps.title: Steep and Press
steps.description: Allow the coffee to steep for 30 seconds to 1 minute (depending on your desired strength). Then, attach the filter cap and carefully press down steadily for 20-30 seconds.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once all the coffee is pressed through, remove the AeroPress and discard the filter cap and coffee grounds. Pour the coffee into your mug, and enjoy a clean, rich cup.

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (93°C)

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the AeroPress?
howWorks.p1: The AeroPress is a compact and versatile coffee brewer that combines elements of both pour-over and espresso brewing techniques. By using air pressure to force hot water through coffee grounds, the AeroPress is capable of producing rich, smooth coffee with minimal bitterness. The filter allows for a clean cup, leaving behind unwanted oils and fine particles.
howWorks.p2: The AeroPress stands out for its simplicity, speed, and portability. It is perfect for anyone seeking a quick brewing process without sacrificing flavor. The versatile design allows for various brewing methods, such as the standard and inverted techniques, enabling you to experiment and find the brewing style that suits your preferences best. Its compact size also makes it ideal for traveling.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Siphon
brewingMethods.description: A mesmerizing brewing method for a clean, flavorful cup

steps.title: Prepare the Equipment
steps.description: Set up your siphon brewing kit with the bottom and top chambers securely attached, ensuring the filter chain is properly positioned inside the top chamber.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 20g of coffee beans and grind them to a medium consistency, similar to sea salt. This ensures the coffee can extract evenly during the brewing process.

steps.title: Add Water to the Bottom Chamber
steps.description: Fill the bottom chamber with 250-300ml of water, ensuring it doesn't exceed the recommended amount for your siphon model.

steps.title: Attach the Filter
steps.description: Carefully attach the filter chain to the bottom of the top chamber and place the top chamber onto the bottom chamber. Make sure the connection is tight and secure.

steps.title: Heat the Water
steps.description: Place the siphon on a heat source and bring the water to a boil. As the water heats up, it will rise into the top chamber through the tube.

steps.title: Add Ground Coffee
steps.description: Once the water has risen into the top chamber, add the ground coffee into the chamber, stirring gently to ensure even saturation of the grounds.

steps.title: Steep the Coffee
steps.description: Allow the coffee to steep for 2-3 minutes, giving it time to extract and develop rich flavors.

steps.title: Remove from Heat and Let Coffee Return
steps.description: After the steeping time is complete, remove the heat source. The brewed coffee will move down into the bottom chamber, leaving the grounds behind.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once the brewing process is complete, carefully remove the top chamber, and serve the coffee from the bottom chamber into your mug for a clean, flavorful cup.

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Siphon?
howWorks.p1: The siphon uses a fascinating vacuum brewing process where the coffee is brewed by moving water and grounds between two chambers. Heat applied to the bottom chamber creates pressure, causing water to rise into the upper chamber, where it infuses with the ground coffee. After a short steeping, the heat is removed, and the brewed coffee returns to the bottom chamber due to the created vacuum. This creates a clean, flavorful cup of coffee.
howWorks.p2: The siphon offers one of the most theatrical and visually stunning methods for brewing coffee, allowing for an almost magical experience. It produces a clean cup with a rich, complex flavor, often with more clarity and body compared to other methods. The ability to control temperature, extraction time, and coffee-to-water ratio makes the siphon an ideal choice for enthusiasts who enjoy fine-tuning their brewing process.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Kalita Wave
brewingMethods.description: Consistent extraction for a smooth, balanced cup

steps.title: Prepare the Filter
steps.description: Place the Kalita Wave filter into the brewer and rinse it with hot water to eliminate any paper taste and preheat the brewer.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 20g of coffee and grind it to a medium-coarse consistency, similar to sea salt, which will allow for even extraction during brewing.

steps.title: Add Ground Coffee to Filter
steps.description: Add the ground coffee into the filter, leveling it out gently to create a uniform surface for the water to flow through.

steps.title: Begin Brewing with Hot Water
steps.description: Start your pour by gently pouring a small amount of hot water (around 205°F/96°C) over the coffee grounds, just enough to bloom. Let it rest for 30 seconds to allow the coffee to release gases.

steps.title: Continue Pouring in a Circular Motion
steps.description: Gradually pour the remaining hot water in a steady, circular motion, starting from the center and moving outwards. Maintain a consistent pour to achieve balanced extraction.

steps.title: Allow the Coffee to Brew
steps.description: Let the coffee brew for around 2-3 minutes, keeping an eye on the water level. The coffee should drip steadily into your mug or carafe below.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once all the water has passed through the coffee grounds, remove the Kalita Wave and discard the filter. Pour the brewed coffee into your cup and enjoy.

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (about 205°F)

howWorks.title1: How Does the Kalita Wave Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Kalita Wave?
howWorks.p1: The Kalita Wave features a flat-bottom design with three small holes that help ensure even water distribution across the coffee grounds. The Wave's unique design allows for a consistent extraction, making it an excellent choice for those looking for a balanced, smooth cup. By pouring water in a circular motion over the grounds, the design helps control the flow rate, ensuring an even and predictable brew.
howWorks.p2: One of the key advantages of the Kalita Wave is its ability to deliver a consistently balanced extraction. The flat-bottom design and the three holes at the bottom ensure that the water flows through the coffee grounds evenly, minimizing any channeling. This brewing method produces a smooth, mellow flavor profile with a clear taste and a well-rounded finish. Additionally, its simplicity makes it easy to master, providing excellent results even for beginners.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Clever Dripper
brewingMethods.description: Full immersion brewing for a rich, full-bodied cup

steps.title: Prepare the Filter
steps.description: Place a paper filter into the Clever Dripper and rinse it with hot water to remove any paper taste and preheat the brewer.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 20g of coffee and grind it to a medium-coarse consistency, similar to sea salt, to allow for even extraction.

steps.title: Add Ground Coffee to the Filter
steps.description: Add the ground coffee to the filter in the Clever Dripper and level it out gently, ensuring an even surface for water to interact with.

steps.title: Begin Brewing with Hot Water
steps.description: Pour hot water (about 205°F/96°C) over the coffee grounds to saturate them fully. Add enough water to cover all the grounds and let them bloom for 30 seconds.

steps.title: Continue Adding Hot Water
steps.description: Pour the rest of the water gently over the coffee grounds in a circular motion until you reach the desired brew volume, making sure to saturate all of the grounds evenly.

steps.title: Let the Coffee Brew
steps.description: Place the Clever Dripper on top of your mug or carafe, and let the coffee steep for about 3-4 minutes, allowing full immersion of the coffee grounds in water.

steps.title: Release the Coffee
steps.description: After brewing, remove the Clever Dripper from the mug or carafe. The valve at the bottom will release the brewed coffee, allowing it to drip through into your cup or carafe.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once the coffee has fully drained through, discard the filter with the spent grounds, and pour yourself a cup of freshly brewed, full-bodied coffee.

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (about 205°F)

howWorks.title1: How Does the Clever Dripper Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Clever Dripper?
howWorks.p1: The Clever Dripper combines the advantages of both pour-over and French press brewing methods. By fully immersing the coffee grounds in water before filtration, it allows for a rich and full-bodied extraction. The valve at the bottom of the Clever Dripper holds the brewed coffee in place until it's ready to be released into your mug or carafe. This method provides precise control over brewing time and allows for a clean, sediment-free cup.
howWorks.p2: The Clever Dripper is an easy-to-use immersion brewer that provides the best of both worlds. The steeping process ensures a rich, full-flavored extraction, while the simple valve system prevents over-extraction. The result is a smooth, clean cup with bold flavors, all in a user-friendly setup. It is perfect for coffee lovers looking to experience the full body of immersion brewing without the complexity of a French press.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with French Press
brewingMethods.description: Rich and full-bodied coffee with a simple brewing method

steps.title: Prepare the French Press
steps.description: Place your French press on a flat surface and remove the plunger. Preheat the French press with hot water and discard it once it’s warmed up.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 30g of coffee and grind it to a coarse consistency, similar to breadcrumbs. A coarse grind ensures smooth extraction and helps avoid over-extraction.

steps.title: Add Coffee Grounds to the French Press
steps.description: Add the ground coffee to the preheated French press. Make sure the coffee is evenly distributed for a consistent brew.

steps.title: Pour Hot Water Over the Coffee
steps.description: Pour 500ml of water just off the boil (about 205°F/96°C) evenly over the coffee grounds to wet all of the grounds. Let it bloom for 30 seconds.

steps.title: Stir the Coffee and Water Mixture
steps.description: After the bloom, gently stir the coffee and water to ensure all the grounds are fully saturated. Place the lid with the plunger pulled up on the French press.

steps.title: Brew for 4 Minutes
steps.description: Let the coffee steep for 4 minutes. During this time, the coffee grounds will continue to infuse the water, extracting flavors for a rich brew.

steps.title: Press the Plunger
steps.description: After 4 minutes, slowly and evenly press down the plunger with steady pressure. This separates the grounds from the brewed coffee.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once the plunger is fully pressed down, pour the brewed coffee into your cup and enjoy the rich, full-bodied flavors of your French press brew.

materialList.itemName: Hot water just off the boil (about 205°F)

howWorks.title1: How Does the French Press Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the French Press?
howWorks.p1: The French Press is an immersion brewing method where coffee grounds are fully saturated by hot water. The brewing process involves steeping the grounds for a period of time before separating them from the coffee using a plunger. This method extracts a high concentration of flavors, resulting in a rich and full-bodied cup. The simple design of the French Press allows for precise control over brewing time and the coffee-to-water ratio, giving you a customizable and straightforward brewing experience.
howWorks.p2: The French Press is popular for its ability to produce coffee that is rich in oils and full of flavor. Unlike drip coffee makers or pour-over methods, it doesn't use paper filters, which means more oils and coffee particles stay in the brew, giving it a thicker and bolder taste. The French Press is also easy to use and maintain, and its versatility makes it a great choice for home coffee brewing, especially for those who prefer strong, aromatic coffee.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Drip Coffee Maker
brewingMethods.description: Convenient and consistent brewing with minimal effort

steps.title: Prepare the Drip Coffee Maker
steps.description: Place the coffee maker on a flat, stable surface. Insert a paper filter into the brew basket, making sure it fits properly.

steps.title: Weigh and Grind Coffee
steps.description: Weigh 20g of coffee and grind it to a medium grind size, similar to table salt. This will ensure an even extraction.

steps.title: Add Coffee Grounds to the Filter
steps.description: Pour the ground coffee into the filter, making sure it's evenly distributed for uniform extraction.

steps.title: Add Water to the Coffee Maker
steps.description: Fill the water reservoir with fresh, filtered water. Use 300ml of water for every 20g of coffee, ensuring an optimal brew ratio.

steps.title: Start Brewing
steps.description: Turn on the drip coffee maker to start brewing. The water will flow through the coffee grounds and paper filter, extracting the flavors into the pot.

steps.title: Wait for the Brew to Finish
steps.description: Allow the brewing process to complete. This typically takes about 5 minutes depending on the coffee maker model.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once the brewing process is finished, pour your fresh coffee into a mug and enjoy the flavorful, well-balanced brew.

howWorks.title1: How Does the Drip Coffee Maker Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Drip Coffee Maker?
howWorks.p1: The drip coffee maker brews coffee through a process known as percolation. Water is heated in a reservoir and then drips down through a coffee filter filled with ground coffee. The hot water absorbs flavors from the coffee grounds as it passes through them and then drips into the pot below. The paper filter ensures that only the brewed coffee makes it into the pot while trapping coffee grounds and oils.
howWorks.p2: Drip coffee makers are incredibly convenient, as they allow you to brew coffee hands-free with consistent results. It's a popular option for daily coffee brewing thanks to its ability to make multiple cups of coffee at once, especially in the morning when you're in a rush. This method is also easy to use, maintain, and clean, making it a perfect choice for beginners or people who prefer simplicity without sacrificing quality.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Cold Brew
brewingMethods.description: Smooth and rich coffee brewed with cold water over a long period

steps.title: Grind the Coffee Beans
steps.description: Weigh 60g of coffee beans and grind them coarsely, similar to breadcrumbs. This will ensure slow extraction during the brewing process.

steps.title: Combine Coffee and Water
steps.description: Place the ground coffee in a large jar or pitcher. Add 750ml of cold, filtered water. Stir gently to ensure the grounds are fully saturated.

steps.title: Let It Steep
steps.description: Cover the jar and let the coffee steep in the fridge for 12-24 hours, depending on how strong you want your cold brew to be. The longer it steeps, the stronger the flavor.

steps.title: Filter the Coffee
steps.description: After steeping, filter the coffee through a fine mesh sieve or coffee filter to remove the coffee grounds. You can use a cold brew coffee maker if you have one.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Pour the filtered cold brew into a glass filled with ice. Add milk, sweetener, or water if desired, and enjoy your smooth, rich cold brew coffee.

materialList.itemName: Fine mesh sieve or coffee filter

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of Cold Brew?
howWorks.p1: Cold brew coffee is made by steeping coarsely ground coffee beans in cold water over an extended period (12-24 hours). The slow extraction process results in a smoother, less acidic flavor compared to hot brewing methods. Since the coffee is never exposed to heat, the oils and flavors are gently extracted, giving cold brew coffee its characteristic richness.
howWorks.p2: Cold brew coffee is a great option for those who prefer a smooth and less acidic coffee. It’s perfect for making coffee in bulk and storing in the fridge for later use. Cold brew is also versatile and can be served plain, or diluted with milk, water, or sweeteners. It’s especially refreshing in hot weather and gives a mellow, highly enjoyable cup.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Espresso Machine
brewingMethods.description: Intense, concentrated coffee brewed with pressurized water through finely-ground coffee

steps.title: Preheat the Espresso Machine
steps.description: Turn on your espresso machine and allow it to fully preheat. The machine should reach a temperature of around 90°C to ensure optimal brewing conditions.

steps.title: Grind the Coffee Beans
steps.description: Grind 18-20g of high-quality coffee beans to a fine consistency, similar to table salt. The grind size is critical for proper extraction.

steps.title: Tamp the Coffee Grounds
steps.description: Add the ground coffee to the espresso portafilter and evenly distribute it. Use a tamper to apply firm, even pressure to ensure a consistent puck and uniform extraction.

steps.title: Brew the Espresso
steps.description: Lock the portafilter into the machine and start the brewing process. The espresso should take 25-30 seconds to extract, with a rich, creamy consistency and a golden crema on top.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Once your espresso shot is ready, serve it immediately. You can enjoy it as is or use it as the base for drinks like lattes or cappuccinos.

howWorks.title1: How Does the Espresso Machine Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of an Espresso Machine?
howWorks.p1: An espresso machine brews coffee by forcing pressurized water through finely-ground coffee. The process is quick, taking about 25-30 seconds for a standard espresso shot, and produces a concentrated coffee with a layer of golden crema on top. The high pressure extracted from the coffee grounds ensures a rich, full-bodied flavor with bold characteristics.
howWorks.p2: Using an espresso machine allows for consistent, high-quality extraction each time, making it ideal for coffee lovers who crave strong, rich espresso. It is perfect for making single or double shots of espresso, and it is versatile enough to be used for creating various espresso-based drinks such as lattes, cappuccinos, and Americanos. A great espresso machine offers precise temperature control, consistent pressure, and a sturdy build, ensuring a premium coffee experience every time.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Moka Pot
brewingMethods.description: Classic stovetop brewing method that creates a rich, espresso-like coffee

steps.title: Fill the Bottom Chamber with Water
steps.description: Pour water into the bottom chamber of the Moka Pot up to the safety valve. Use filtered water to ensure the best taste.

steps.title: Add Coffee Grounds to the Filter Basket
steps.description: Fill the filter basket with 15-18g of medium-fine ground coffee, leveling it off without pressing it down.

steps.title: Assemble the Moka Pot
steps.description: Place the filter basket into the bottom chamber and screw the top chamber tightly onto the bottom, making sure everything is sealed properly.

steps.title: Place on Heat Source
steps.description: Put the assembled Moka Pot on your stovetop over medium heat. Wait for the coffee to begin bubbling and steaming from the spout.

steps.title: Remove from Heat
steps.description: Once the bubbling sounds slow down and there is less steam coming from the spout, remove the Moka Pot from the heat. This signals that the brewing is complete.

steps.title: Serve and Enjoy
steps.description: Open the Moka Pot, pour the freshly brewed coffee into your cup, and enjoy the rich, espresso-like coffee.

howWorks.title1: How Does the Moka Pot Work?
howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Moka Pot?
howWorks.p1: The Moka Pot is a stovetop coffee maker that brews coffee by creating pressure in the bottom chamber as water heats up. This pressure forces water through the coffee grounds in the filter basket, and the brewed coffee rises up through a tube into the upper chamber, where it’s collected. The result is a rich, full-bodied coffee that closely resembles espresso in strength and taste.
howWorks.p2: The Moka Pot is an excellent choice for brewing strong coffee without requiring an espresso machine. It is compact, portable, and highly affordable, making it a popular option for home brewing and travel. Its classic design allows for control over the brewing process, and the resulting coffee is robust, intense, and perfect for making coffee-based drinks like lattes and mochas.

brewingMethods.title: Brewing Guide with Ibrik
brewingMethods.description: Traditional Turkish brewing method for a rich, thick, and flavorful coffee

steps.title: Add Coffee and Water to the Ibrik
steps.description: Measure 1-2 heaping teaspoons of very finely ground coffee per cup and add it to the Ibrik. Pour in cold, filtered water (about 60-90ml per serving).

steps.title: Add Sugar (Optional)
steps.description: If you prefer sweet coffee, add sugar at this stage. Adjust the sweetness according to your taste: 1-2 teaspoons for a moderately sweet coffee.

steps.title: Mix and Start Heating
steps.description: Stir the mixture of coffee, water, and sugar well to dissolve the coffee grounds and sugar evenly before heating it over low heat.

steps.title: Bring to a Boil
steps.description: Place the Ibrik on low heat, allowing it to warm up slowly. As the coffee heats, a foam will begin to form. Watch closely to avoid overflowing as the foam rises.

steps.title: Remove and Stir
steps.description: Once the foam begins to rise, remove the Ibrik from heat just before it boils over. Stir gently to mix the foam back into the coffee, then place it back on the heat.

steps.title: Repeat Heating and Stirring
steps.description: Repeat the process of removing from the heat and stirring 2-3 times to enhance the flavor and create a thick, creamy foam.

steps.title: Pour and Enjoy
steps.description: Once the coffee has reached your desired strength and foam, pour it into your cup. Do not stir after pouring, as the grounds will settle at the bottom.

howWorks.title2: What Are the Advantages of the Ibrik?
howWorks.p1: The Ibrik (or cezve) is a small pot traditionally used for brewing Turkish coffee. The coffee is made by combining finely ground coffee with cold water and sugar (optional), then gently heating the mixture over low heat. The Ibrik is heated repeatedly to form a rich foam and ensure that the coffee grounds are not stirred during brewing, which gives the coffee its distinctive strength and texture. This method creates a dense, flavorful cup of coffee with a pronounced aroma.
howWorks.p2: The Ibrik is ideal for brewing intensely rich and thick coffee, with a strong body and a fine layer of foam. Because it requires careful attention during the brewing process, it offers more control over the brewing process and allows for personal customization in terms of sweetness and strength. The Ibrik is portable, easy to use, and can be a fascinating addition to any coffee lover’s toolkit.

aboutUs.title: Terra Café
aboutUs.subTitle: The Land of Flavor and Aroma
aboutUs.description: Every cup of coffee has a new story to tell
aboutUs.Story: Terra Café is a small land with big stories—a place where the aroma of coffee meets the taste of authenticity. The name Terra, inspired by the Latin word for land and farm, reflects both our café as our little homeland and our tribute to coffee farms around the world. We fell in love with the rich and intricate world of coffee—a universe filled with unique flavors and unforgettable aromas. This passion drove us to create a space where we could not only enjoy coffee but also share the art and culture of it with others. Terra Café was born to provide a friendly yet professional environment where every offering you a glimpse into the fascinating world of specialty coffee.

options.Title: The Flavor Wizard
options.story: flavors and experimenting with different combinations. Her love for unique tastes has made her a creative barista. Sara is always eager to try new beans and innovative methods. For her, every cup of coffee is an opportunity to tell a new story. If you ever taste a coffee with an extraordinary flavor, know that it’s Sara’s magic behind it!

options.Title: The Brewing Equipment Specialist
options.story: Nima has a special interest in various brewing techniques. He is a curious and passionate learner, always seeking better ways to extract the finest flavors from coffee beans. Nima is skilled with all brewing tools and can create diverse flavors using each of them. If you want a coffee brewed with precision and expertise, Nima is the one you can trust.

options.Title: The Espresso Master
options.story: Arya is a precise and dedicated individual who values attention to detail. He is deeply passionate about espresso and the intricate process of making it. For Arya, crafting an espresso is an art that requires focus and mastery. He ensures that every extraction is perfect, capturing the full flavor and aroma of the beans. Arya’s espresso is the flawless foundation for any coffee beverage.

options.Title: The Latte Art Artist
options.story: Mina has always been in love with art and design. When she entered the world of coffee, she found a way to channel her creativity through latte art. She believes the visual beauty of a drink is an essential part of the coffee experience. With her precision and finesse, Mina transforms every cup into a masterpiece. Her lattes are not only delicious but also leave you in awe with their stunning designs.

sections.title: Roastery
sections.desc: The aroma of freshly roasted beans promises an exceptional cup of coffee. Our beans are carefully selected and roasted to perfection.

sections.title: Coffee Drinks
sections.desc: Brewed with love, every sip of our coffee tells a story of unparalleled taste and aroma. From bold espressos to creamy cappuccinos, we're here for you!

sections.title: Bakery
sections.desc: From warm, freshly baked bread to delightful pastries, feel the homemade touch in every bite. Everything is here for your indulgence.

sections.title: Snacks and Sides
sections.desc: Snacks that bring a smile to your face! From delicious croissants to energizing bites, we're here to make your day better.
